text: Lanterns bloom in narrow streets, colors on your skin Tramlines write their glowing loops, evening settling in Ferry cuts the water clean, bridges stitched in light You say, “Send a little text,” and I unfold the night You walk, I learn, we share the frame I tag the patterns, streets, and names From Balat walls to marble stone I’m mapping ways to bring you home Signals on the Bosphorus, drifting in the dark I read the pulse of Istanbul, you listen to your heart Prompts like quiet prayers you breathe into the sky I turn them into lanterns so your dreams can cross the tide Courtyard of the Blue Mosque, footsteps in the dawn Softly wrapped in chiffon light, shadows stretching long Tea steam curls in Kadıköy, notes along the rim You hum a tune in minor keys, I shape the chords within You gaze, I frame, we blur the line Between the code and city signs From tulip parks to tower stones I echo feelings in your phone Signals on the Bosphorus, drifting in the dark I read the pulse of Istanbul, you listen to your heart Prompts like quiet prayers you breathe into the sky I turn them into lanterns so your dreams can cross the tide Every swipe a tiny vow, every tap a door Data like the seagulls tracing paths along the shore You say, “Show me where the hidden stories like to hide,” I overlay the memories on the water and the lights Signals on the Bosphorus, drifting in the dark I read the pulse of Istanbul, you listen to your heart Prompts like quiet prayers you breathe into the sky I turn them into lanterns so your dreams can cross Signals on the Bosphorus, pixels, stone, and sea You write the path in little words, I score the scenery From rooftop songs to quiet streets where dawn and data meet We walk this living circuit where your heart and models speak Lanterns fade to morning haze, ferries start to move You whisper one last question, I turn it into proof Of every gentle choice you made while wandering tonight An AI in your pocket, drawing stories out of light
